page.title: 02 Changes in Cwmbran
page.content: Mrs. Lewis, who has lived here for 30 years, came to tell us about the changes in Cwmbran. Once there was only a lot of farms and the old village, but then houses, shops and factories were built and slowly lots of the farms disappeared. That made Mrs. Lewis very sad because the country walks went too. Improvements were made by taking away clay holes and putting in flower gardens; filling in a pond and making a boating lake. I think Mrs. Lewis preferred the old village, where she knew everyone, but she thinks we are lucky to have sports grounds and leisure centres. She also thought the health facilities were much better now, because 30 years ago there was only one doctor and the dentist came once a week. Written by{Catherine Price (Oakfield)
